member.name: M:Sitecore.Social.Domain.IMessageManager.GetMessagesReadyToPostAutomatically(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Sitecore.Social.Domain.Model.Identifier})
member.summary: Gets messages that are ready to be posted automatically.
member.returns: The messages list. If no messages are found an empty list is returned.
member.remarks:
This method will search messages by the following parameters:
Content posting configuration.
Content item is published.
"Post automatically" is checked.
Message is not in a workflow. Or message is in a final workflow state.
Message is not posted.

member.name: M:Sitecore.Social.Domain.ISocialProfileManager.RefreshSocialProfiles(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Refreshes all social profiles attached to a user from social networks.
member.param: if set to true the social profiles will be refreshed asynchronously.
member.remarks: Only expired social profiles will be refreshed. The expiration configuration is defined in "Social.ProfileUpdating.DaysBeforeExpiration" setting.

member.name: M:Sitecore.Social.Domain.ISocialProfileManager.RefreshSocialProfiles(Sitecore.Social.Domain.Model.Identifier,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Refreshes all social profiles attached to a contact from social networks.
member.param: if set to true the social profiles will be refreshed asynchronously.
member.remarks: Only expired social profiles will be refreshed. The expiration configuration is defined in "Social.ProfileUpdating.DaysBeforeExpiration" setting.

member.name: M:Sitecore.Social.Domain.ISocialProfileManager.RefreshSocialProfiles(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Refreshes all social profiles attached to a user from social networks.
member.param: if set to true the social profiles will be refreshed asynchronously.
if set to true the expiration configuration of the social profile will be ignored and the social profiles will be refreshed in any case.

member.name: M:Sitecore.Social.Domain.ISocialProfileManager.RefreshSocialProfiles(Sitecore.Social.Domain.Model.Identifier,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Refreshes all social profiles attached to a contact from social networks.
member.param: if set to true the social profiles will be refreshed asynchronously.
if set to true the expiration configuration of the social profile will be ignored and the social profiles will be refreshed in any case.

member.summary: Refreshes the social profile attached to a user from the specified network.
member.remarks: The expiration configuration of the social profile will be ignored and the social profile will be refreshed in any case.

member.name: M:Sitecore.Social.Domain.ISocialProfileManager.RefreshSocialProfile(Sitecore.Social.Domain.Model.Identifier,System.String)
member.summary: Refreshes the social profile attached to a contact from the specified network.
member.remarks: The expiration configuration of the social profile will be ignored and the social profile will be refreshed in any case.

member.name: M:Sitecore.Social.Domain.ISocialProfileManager.RefreshSocialProfile(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Refreshes the social profile attached to a user from the specified network.
member.param: if set to true the social profile will be refreshed asynchronously.
member.remarks: The expiration configuration of the social profile will be ignored and the social profile will be refreshed in any case.

member.name: M:Sitecore.Social.Domain.ISocialProfileManager.RefreshSocialProfile(Sitecore.Social.Domain.Model.Identifier,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Refreshes the social profile attached to a contact from the specified network.
member.param: if set to true the social profile will be refreshed asynchronously.
member.remarks: The expiration configuration of the social profile will be ignored and the social profile will be refreshed in any case.

member.name: P:Sitecore.Social.Domain.Model.ApplicationCredentials.PublicApiKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the public API key.
member.remarks: For a Google application it's an API key (a server key) - a unique identifier that you generate using the Developers Console. Using an API key does not require user action or consent. API keys do not grant access to any account information, and are not used for authorization. If your client application does not use OAuth 2.0, then it must include an API key when it calls an API that's enabled within a Developers Console project. The application passes this key into all API requests as a key=API_key parameter.
